actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to discourage the production of one-way containers for carbonated and/or malt beverages so as to reduce litter, reduce the cost of solid waste management, and to conserve natural resources.

summary.text: Makes it unlawful to package carbonated and/or malt beverages in one way containers which have been manufactured for sale, sold, offered for sale, or introduced or delivered for introduction in interstate commerce. Imposes a civil penalty not to exceed $1,000 for violations of this Act. Provides that each container violating this Act shall constitute a separate violation. Allows a tax deduction under the Internal Revenue Code for equipment necessary for the conversion to the manufacture of returnable containers.

titles.title: A bill to discourage the production of one-way containers for carbonated and/or malt beverages so as to reduce litter, reduce the cost of solid waste management, and to conserve natural resources.
